info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 16 at 12:21AM CDT until June 16 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following counties, Howell, Oregon and Shannon.
* WHEN...Until 600 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1221 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Sycamore Creek at Highway H, Middle Fork Eleven Point River at County Road 1420, Bennetts River at Highway 142, Howell Creek at County Road 9790, Warm Fork Spring River at County Road 323, Eleven Point River at County Road 1550 and Piney Creek at County Road 228. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Mountain View, Thayer, Willow Springs, Winona, Alton, Birch Tree, Pomona, South Fork, Koshkonong, Brandsville, Montier, Thomasville, Rover, Peace Valley, White Church, Teresita, Greer, Couch, Lanton, Wilderness, Myrtle, Pottersville, Moody, Grand Gulf State Park and Ozark National Scenic Riverways. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY

area.areaDesc: Howell, MO; Oregon, MO; Shannon, MO
